hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition Triggered by Stablecoin Supply Contraction
hypothesis_content.statement: During a NEUTRAL regime, a 5%+ contraction in the aggregate circulating supply of major stablecoins (USDT, USDC, DAI) over a 15-day period, combined with BTC failing to hold above its volume-weighted average price (VWAP) from the past 30 days, signals a high-probability transition to a BEAR regime.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Stablecoin supply is a direct proxy for dry powder in crypto. Contraction indicates net capital outflow from the ecosystem. In a neutral regime, this removal of liquidity, especially when paired with BTC breaking a key level (30-day VWAP) and sentiment worsening, is a potent recipe for a bearish shift.
entry_conditions: BTC price < 30-day VWAP (calculated on-chain or CEX volume)
Crypto Fear & Greed Index drops by 15+ points in 3 days

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Stablecoin supply reverses trend and grows by >2% within 5 days of signal, AND BTC reclaims and holds 30-day VWAP
exit_conditions.time_exit: 15 days if no regime transition occurs

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Stablecoin outflow is temporary (e.g., moving to yield elsewhere) and is quickly reversed by new inflows before price breaks down.
